title: DB Corruption after a memory incident
body:
The system ran out of available memory. Erigon failed to write a block body to the mdbx database, and after restarting, it won't sync past this block. 

#### Full logs
[logs-dappnode-package-DAppNodePackage-erigon.erigon.dnp.dappnode.eth.txt.zip](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/files/13727996/logs-dappnode-package-DAppNodePackage-erigon.erigon.dnp.dappnode.eth.txt.zip)

Incident start: `[WARN] [12-20|04:09:36.807] [5/7 Execution] Execution failed`
Main warning since then, after multiple restarts: `[WARN] [12-20|08:14:37.959] [EngineBlockDownloader] Could not insert headers and bodies err="missing body at block=18824641"`

#### Bonus question
Is it possible to rollback the db so that Erigon re-downloads the block bodies and continue syncing? Or do I have to delete the db and sync from scratch?
Thank you!

#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2.50.1-c91efdcb`

OS & Version: Linux (Dappnode)

Commit hash: c91efdcb2e885089d95a551c5ec7fa440d53d156

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
```
erigon --datadir=${DATADIR} \
    --http.addr=0.0.0.0 \
    --http.vhosts=* \
    --http.corsdomain=* \
    --ws \
    --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:9090 \
    --metrics \
    --metrics.addr=0.0.0.0 \
    --metrics.port=6060 \
    --pprof \
    --pprof.addr=0.0.0.0 \
    --pprof.port=6061 \
    --port=${P2P_PORT} \
    --authrpc.jwtsecret=${JWT_PATH} \
    --authrpc.addr 0.0.0.0 \
    --authrpc.vhosts=* \
    --http.api=engine,eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool
```
Consensus Layer: Nimbus 23.5.1

Chain/Network: Mainnet
